description: Difference between n^2 and largest prime less than n^2.
comments: Legendre's conjecture (still open) that there is always a prime between n^2 and (n+1)^2 is equivalent to conjecturing that a(n)<2n-1 for all n>1.Will the most common subsequence seen be (2,3,2)? - _Bill McEachen_, Jan 30 2011
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=2..10000
example: a(4)=3 because largest prime less than 4^2 is 13 and 16-13=3.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 12 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Jul 13 2000
